bitenum.description: The MAC filters all control frames from reaching application
MAC forwards all control frames except PAUSE control frames to application even if they fail the address filter
MAC forwards all control frames to application even if they fail the address Filter
MAC forwards control frames that pass the address Filter
The frequency of the System Clock is 60 to 100 MHz providing a MDIO clock of SYSCLK/42
The frequency of the System Clock is 100 to 150 MHz providing a MDIO clock of SYSCLK/62
The frequency of the System Clock is 20-35 MHz providing a MDIO clock of System Clock/16
The frequency of the System Clock is 35 to 60 MHz providing a MDIO clock of System Clock/26

bitfield.description: Flow Control Busy or Back-pressure Activate
VLAN Tag Identifier for Receive Frames
VLAN Tag Hash Table Match Enable
MAC MII Receive Protocol Engine Status
MAC Receive Frame Controller FIFO Status
TX/RX Controller RX FIFO Write Controller Active Status

bitenum.description: Flushing the frame data and status

bitfield.description: TX/RX Controller RX FIFO Fill-level Status

bitenum.description: RX FIFO fill level is below the flow-control deactivate threshold
RX FIFO fill level is above the flow-control activate threshold

bitfield.description: MAC MII Transmit Protocol Engine Status

bitenum.description: Waiting for status of previous frame or IFG or backoff period to be over
Generating and transmitting a PAUSE control frame (in the full-duplex mode)

bitfield.description: TX/RX Controller's TX FIFO Read Controller Status

bitenum.description: READ state (transferring data to MAC transmitter)
Waiting for TX Status from MAC transmitter
Writing the received TX Status or flushing the TX FIFO

bitfield.description: TX/RX Controller TX FIFO Write Controller Active Status
TX/RX Controller TX FIFO Not Empty Status
TX/RX Controller TX FIFO Full Status

Update MMC Counters for Dropped Broadcast Frames

register.description: Ethernet MAC Transmit Frame Count for Good and Bad Frames

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of good and bad frames transmitted, exclusive of retried frames

register.description: Ethernet MAC Transmit Frame Count for Frames Transmitted after Single Collision

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of successfully transmitted frames after a single collision in the half-duplex mode

register.description: Ethernet MAC Transmit Frame Count for Frames Transmitted after Multiple Collisions

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of successfully transmitted frames after multiple collisions in the half-duplex mode

register.description: Ethernet MAC Transmit Octet Count Good

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of bytes transmitted, exclusive of preamble, in good frames

register.description: Ethernet MAC Receive Frame Count for Good and Bad Frames

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of received good and bad frames

register.description: Ethernet MAC Receive Frame Count for CRC Error Frames

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of frames received with CRC error

register.description: Ethernet MAC Receive Frame Count for Alignment Error Frames

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of frames received with alignment (dribble) error

register.description: Ethernet MAC Receive Frame Count for Good Unicast Frames

bitfield.description: This field indicates the number of received good unicast frames

register.description: Ethernet MAC VLAN Tag Inclusion or Replacement

bitfield.description: VLAN Tag Control in Transmit Frames

bitenum.description: No VLAN tag deletion, insertion, or replacement

bitfield.description: Timestamp Digital or Binary Rollover Control
Enable PTP Packet Processing For Version 2 Format
Enable Processing of PTP Over Ethernet Frames
Enable Processing of PTP Frames Sent Over IPv6-UDP
Enable Processing of PTP Frames Sent over IPv4-UDP
Enable Timestamp Snapshot for Event Messages
Enable Snapshot for Messages Relevant to Master
Select PTP packets for Taking Snapshots
Enable MAC address for PTP Frame Filtering

register.description: Ethernet MAC System Time - Seconds Update
Ethernet MAC System Time - Nanoseconds Update
Ethernet MAC System Time-Higher Word Seconds

bitfield.description: EN0PPS Output Frequency Control (PPSCTRL) or Command Control (PPSCMD)
Target Time Register Mode for PPS0 Output

bitenum.description: Indicates that the Target Time registers are programmed only for generating the interrupt event
Indicates that the Target Time registers are programmed for generating the interrupt event and starting or stopping the generation of the EN0PPS output signal
Indicates that the Target Time registers are programmed only for starting or stopping the generation of the EN0PPS output signal. No interrupt is asserted

register.description: Ethernet MAC Receive Descriptor List Address
Ethernet MAC Transmit Descriptor List Address

bitfield.description: Start of Transmit List Base Address

bitenum.description: Stopped: Reset or stop receive command issued
Running: Transferring the receive packet data from receive buffer to host memory
Stopped; Reset or Stop transmit command processed
Running; Reading data from host memory buffer and queuing it to transmit buffer (TX FIFO)
Suspended; Transmit descriptor unavailable or transmit buffer underflow
Error during RX DMA Write Data Transfer
Error during TX DMA Read Data Transfer
Error during RX DMA Descriptor Write Access
Error during TX DMA Descriptor Write Access
Error during RX DMA Descriptor Read Access
Error during TX DMA Descriptor Read Access

bitfield.description: Disable Dropping of TCP/IP Checksum Error Frames

bitfield.description: Overflow bit for Missed Frame Counter

Ethernet MAC Current Host Receive Descriptor

Ethernet MAC Current Host Receive Buffer Address

bitenum.description: When ANEN = 0x0, the mode is 10Base-T, Half-Duplex
When ANEN = 0x0, the mode is 10Base-T, Full-Duplex
When ANEN = 0x0, the mode is 100Base-TX, Half-Duplex
When ANEN = 0x0, the mode is 100Base-TX, Full-Duplex
MII (default) Used for internal PHY or external PHY connected via MII
RMII: Used for external PHY connected via RMII
